repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Rename the field `result` to `params` in the `data` table for
`LspProgress` autocmds.

The previous name was chosen because the initial handler implementation (#23958)
mistakenly had a parameter name `result` instead of `params` for the
`$/progress` LSP "notification" handler. However, `params` would be a
more appropriate name that is more consistent with the underlying LSP
type (`ProgressParams`). See #27101 for more context.

See also: https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/specification-current/#progress

This change is technically a breaking change within the nvim-0.10
development versions, so any existing autocmd handlers for `LspProgress`
might break after this commit. User configs and plugins are advised to
update autocmd handlers accordingly (see `:help LspProgress`).

comment_data.body:
p.s. we have an `event-data` help tag now.
```suggestion
    The Lua |event-data| table contains a `client_id` and
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -553,14 +553,14 @@ LspNotify                                                          *LspNotify*
 LspProgress                                                       *LspProgress*
     Upon receipt of a progress notification from the server. Notifications can
     be polled from a `progress` ring buffer of a |vim.lsp.Client| or use
-    |vim.lsp.status()| to get an aggregate message
+    |vim.lsp.status()| to get an aggregate message.
 
     If the server sends a "work done progress", the `pattern` is set to `kind`
     (one of `begin`, `report` or `end`).
 
     When used from Lua, the event contains a `data` table with `client_id` and

comment_data.body: Most of the other handlers in this file name this parameter `result`. Should that be changed? Or is this PR specific to the Progress event? If `result` is generally the right name for this parameter, I suggest keeping this parameter name as `result`, and only change the `data` key.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -22,38 +22,38 @@ M[ms.workspace_executeCommand] = function(_, _, _, _)
 end
 
 --- @see # https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/specification-current/#progress
----@param result lsp.ProgressParams
+---@param params lsp.ProgressParams
 ---@param ctx lsp.HandlerContext
-M[ms.dollar_progress] = function(_, result, ctx)
+M[ms.dollar_progress] = function(_, params, ctx)

@@ -22,38 +22,38 @@ M[ms.workspace_executeCommand] = function(_, _, _, _)
 end
 
 --- @see # https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/specification-current/#progress
----@param result lsp.ProgressParams
+---@param params lsp.ProgressParams
 ---@param ctx lsp.HandlerContext
-M[ms.dollar_progress] = function(_, result, ctx)
+M[ms.dollar_progress] = function(_, params, ctx)
   local client = vim.lsp.get_client_by_id(ctx.client_id)
   if not client then
     err_message('LSP[id=', tostring(ctx.client_id), '] client has shut down during progress update')
     return vim.NIL
   end
   local kind = nil
-  local value = result.value
+  local value = params.value
 
   if type(value) == 'table' then
     kind = value.kind
     -- Carry over title of `begin` messages to `report` and `end` messages
     -- So that consumers always have it available, even if they consume a
     -- subset of the full sequence
     if kind == 'begin' then
-      client.progress.pending[result.token] = value.title
+      client.progress.pending[params.token] = value.title
     else
-      value.title = client.progress.pending[result.token]
+      value.title = client.progress.pending[params.token]
       if kind == 'end' then
-        client.progress.pending[result.token] = nil
+        client.progress.pending[params.token] = nil
       end
     end
   end
 
-  client.progress:push(result)
+  client.progress:push(params)
 
   api.nvim_exec_autocmds('LspProgress', {
     pattern = kind,
     modeline = false,
-    data = { client_id = ctx.client_id, result = result },
+    data = { client_id = ctx.client_id, params = params },

comment_data.body:
The handler here is for a notification (sent from server to the client), `params` is the right choice here. (https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#notificationMessage)  
Most of the other handlers are response handlers. `result` is the right choice for them.  (https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#responseMessage)

That we put response, server->client request and notification handlers into the same table can be a bit confusing.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -22,38 +22,38 @@ M[ms.workspace_executeCommand] = function(_, _, _, _)
 end
 
 --- @see # https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/specification-current/#progress
----@param result lsp.ProgressParams
+---@param params lsp.ProgressParams
 ---@param ctx lsp.HandlerContext
-M[ms.dollar_progress] = function(_, result, ctx)
+M[ms.dollar_progress] = function(_, params, ctx)

comment_data.body: Please see #27101, which tries to fix the parameter names in other handlers as well: in short, all "request" and "notification" handlers (but not "response" handlers) should have `params` instead of `result`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -22,38 +22,38 @@ M[ms.workspace_executeCommand] = function(_, _, _, _)
 end
 
 --- @see # https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/specification-current/#progress
----@param result lsp.ProgressParams
+---@param params lsp.ProgressParams
 ---@param ctx lsp.HandlerContext
-M[ms.dollar_progress] = function(_, result, ctx)
+M[ms.dollar_progress] = function(_, params, ctx)

comment_regular_data.body:
I hope this is not too late for Nvim 0.10 (#23235). It might be better to consider fixing this at the moment rather than having a breaking change after the release.

Alternatively, we could instead:

- Just keep it as-is, rejecting the change proposed in this PR (i.e. `data = { result = params }`); or
- Have a duplicate field (or using a metatable) for both `result` and `params` (with or without soft deprecation) to avoid breaking [downstream plugins and user configs](https://grep.app/search?q=%5B%22%27%5DLspProgress%5B%22%27%5D&regexp=true). But we could have breaking changes during the dev cycle, if necessary.

I would leave the decision to other core devs, and will be happy to update the PR as necessary.

Not sure if this is worth the churn.
I'd tend to leave it as it is, but let's see what the others think

It's not so much churn since this was initially introduced in this cycle which is what motivated the PR. We either do it now or never I guess.

I vote we just do it. We shouldn't consider unreleased code as part of churn.

this PR has break `nvim-lspconfig`, I have to reset version/commit and rebuild neovim to make it works. Please review this again.

the main error is due to "Error on execute autocmd 'LspProgress'" on nvim runtime `handlers.lua:53` (It's in my language I don't know the exactly info)

@xanahopper nvim-lspconfig has no `LspProgress` autocmd handler defined, so it's likely to be a problem of either your config or any plugins you are using, rather than nvim-lspconfig, yet to be catching up the breaking change. As noted, downstreams plugins and configs should update accordingly (see, for example, https://github.com/folke/noice.nvim/pull/785). If you need a help, please open a new issue/discussion with full details provided.
@wookayin Yes, you're right, I just noticed that.

title: fix(lsp): rename LspProgress data.result => data.params
